original_title: Use of two anaesthetic drugs suspended
original_body_lines: The Director General of Health Services (DGHS), Dr. Asela Gunawardena today announced the suspension of two anaesthetic drugs, based on a report from the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA).

Speaking to the media after an event in Anuradhapura today, Dr. Gunawardena explained that alternative drugs have been identified to replace the suspended anaesthetics. He assured the public that the replacements would be distributed on time to all hospitals.
Dr. Gunawardena emphasized that the process of replacing a drug when complications arise is a normal procedure and should not cause alarm.

Meanwhile, addressing concerns regarding the import of substandard drugs, Dr. Gunawardena stated that such imports are not approved under any circumstances. He further asserted that Sri Lanka's drug imports are always in line with the standards set by the State Pharmaceutical Corporation (SPC). (Sheain Fernandopulle)
